revised_title: Radiation in Explosions of Coal-Gas and Air: A Study of Heat Loss and Diathermancy
tldr: This article investigates the radiation emitted during the explosion and subsequent cooling of coal-gas and air mixtures. The authors measure the heat loss through radiation and study the diathermancy and emissive power of the hot gaseous mixture after explosion. Their findings offer an explanation for the peculiar results observed in previous experiments involving explosions of coal-gas and air.
